marketNews.title: Government Prepares Second Round of Economic Stimulus
marketNews.content:
Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Saturday (24/5) that the government is preparing 6 packages of economic stimulus measures to maintain public purchasing power, especially during the school holiday period in June-July 2025. These six economic stimulus measures are currently being finalized and are planned to be launched on June 5, 2025, focusing on increasing public activity in the transportation, energy, and social assistance sectors. Here are the details:
1. Discount on train tickets, airplanes, and sea transportation during the school holiday period.
2. Toll road tariff reduction in June-July 2025 for 110 million users.
3. Electricity tariff discount of 50% in June-July 2025, targeted at 79.3 million households with electricity capacity up to 1,300 VA.
4. Staple food card and food assistance for 18.3 million beneficiary families (KPM).
5. Wage subsidy assistance (BSU) for workers with salaries below 3.5 million rupiah or according to the provincial minimum wage (UMP).
6. Discount on work accident insurance contributions (JKK) for workers in labor-intensive sectors.
The government also invites local governments to play an active role in creating local tourism and entertainment activities to encourage domestic public movement during the school holidays. This is the second economic stimulus provided by the government this year. Previously, the government released economic stimulus in January-February 2025.
Core Indonesia Researcher, Yusuf Rendy Manilet, stated that the stimulus package appears to be an emergency measure taken by the government to prevent economic growth from declining further. Yusuf explained that household consumption has the potential to slow down in 2Q25, considering the absence of seasonal moments that usually boost public spending such as Ramadan or Eid al-Fitr.
In 1Q25 itself, Indonesia's economic growth reached only +4.87% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +5.11% YoY, 4Q24: +5.02% YoY) - lower than the government's 2025 target of +5.2% YoY - with household consumption declining to +4.89% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +4.91% YoY).
Key Takeaway
We assess the launch of this stimulus package as one of the government's steps to boost economic growth through accelerated spending, after the State Budget returned to a better position in 4M25. Besides accelerating government spending, the prospect of an interest rate cut and an improved investment climate along with the de-escalation of the trade war has the potential to be another source to boost growth, so these factors need to be considered by investors.
In general, this stimulus package will have a positive impact on consumption, especially the lower to middle segments. This can be positive sentiment for issuers such as ICBP, MYOR and AMRT.

tickerNews.title: OJK: PNBN & BCIC Exploring Strategic Investor Presence
tickerNews.content: PNBN: Head of Banking Supervision OJK, Dian Ediana Rae, stated that a number of banks are seeking new capital injections and are exploring the presence of strategic investors, including Bank Pan Indonesia (PNBN), Bank JTrust (BCIC), and Bank Muamalat. Dian also said that if there are applications from potential strategic investors to invest in the Indonesian banking sector, OJK will immediately conduct an evaluation and follow up according to applicable provisions. Previously, Reuters reported in March 2025 that DBS Group and CIMB Group were competing to buy a controlling stake in PNBN. Reuters sources said that around 86% of PNBN shares are ready to be sold, where this ownership portion is a combination of the ownership from PNBN's controller, the Gunawan family, and ANZ's ownership.

tickerNews.title: Merger between GOTO Gojek Tokopedia and Grab Reportedly Delayed Pending Government Approval
tickerNews.content: GOTO: Kontan reported that the merger between GoTo Gojek Tokopedia and Grab Holdings Ltd. is stalled waiting for government approval. According to Kontan sources, the government sees that if GOTO is divested and merges with Grab, there will be no more indigenous Indonesian start-up companies with decacorn scale. Nevertheless, Kontan sources explained that the transaction is still ongoing and is targeted to be completed in 1H25. Kontan reported that GOTO management is still striving to approach the government to allow GOTO to be released to Grab.

tickerNews.title: PBID to Distribute 2024 Dividend of IDR 55 per Share
tickerNews.content: PBID: Panca Budi Idaman will distribute the 2024 fiscal year dividend of approximately 412.5 billion rupiah or 55 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to an ~85% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~80%) and indicates a 9.9% dividend yield as of Monday (26/5). The cum date on the regular and negotiation market is June 4, 2025, while payment is on June 19, 2025.

tickerNews.title: WIIM Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend of IDR 64.8 per Share
tickerNews.content: WIIM: Wismilak Inti Makmur shareholders approved the plan to distribute a 2024 fiscal year dividend of approximately 135 billion rupiah or 64.8 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to an ~45% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~45%) and indicates a 7.6% dividend yield as of Monday (26/5). Cum date and payment date have not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: INET Targets 1 Million New Homepasses in 2025 and Collaborates on Submarine Cable Asset Utilization with KETR Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: INET: President Director of Inti Andalan Prima, Muhammad Arif, stated that his party is targeting an addition of 1 million new homepasses throughout 2025 through its subsidiary, PT Internet Anak Bangsa. Arif mentioned that the revenue target from the construction of 1 million homepasses reaches 240 billion rupiah and the revenue target from maintenance (recurring income) reaches 192 billion rupiah. Furthermore, INET through its subsidiary, PT Pusat Fiber Indonesia, has also established an indefeasible right of use cooperation with a subsidiary of Ketrosden Triasmitra (KETR), in the utilization of submarine communication cable system (SKKL) assets stretching from Jakarta to Singapore.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Director Sells 800,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: AKRA: Director of AKR Corporindo, Mery Sofi, sold 800,000 AKRA shares at a price of 1,349 rupiah per share on May 21, 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 1.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Mery's ownership in AKRA decreased from 0.015% to 0.011%.

tickerNews.title: SINI Controller Sells Approximately 57.7 Million Shares for Public Float Increase
tickerNews.content: SINI: The shareholder of Singaraja Putra, PT Basis Energi Prima, sold approximately 57.7 million SINI shares at a price of 3,800 rupiah per share on May 23, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 219 billion rupiah and was intended to increase the number of shares in public circulation. After this transaction, PT Basis Energi Prima's ownership in SINI decreased from 12% to none.

tickerNews.title: Persib Bandung Football Club Plans IPO in 2026, Potentially Following Bali United ($BOLA)
tickerNews.content: Persib Bandung Football Club President, Glenn T. Sugita, announced on Saturday (24/5) the discourse of the club conducting an IPO on the IDX in 2026. If realized, Persib Bandung will become the 2nd football club in Indonesia to be listed on the IDX after Bali United, which is listed on the stock exchange through Bali Bintang Sejahtera (BOLA).

tickerNews.title: BEI Index Evaluation: ASII, MTEL, and PGEO Enter Sri-Kehati Index; JPFA, SCMA, and TLKM Exit
tickerNews.content: IDX announced the major evaluation results for the Sri-Kehati index, with the effective period from June 2, 2025, to November 28, 2025. ASII, MTEL, and PGEO are included in the index, while JPFA, SCMA, and TLKM are excluded.

tickerNews.title: FTSE Russell Rebalancing: AADI Enters Small Cap, DAAZ Enters Micro Cap, Effective June 23, 2025
tickerNews.content: FTSE Russell announced the rebalancing for the FTSE Global Equity Index Series, which will take effect after the close of trading on June 20, 2025, and be effective starting June 23, 2025. There are no changes in the Large Cap and Mid Cap categories. Meanwhile, AADI enters the Small Cap index and DAAZ enters the Micro Cap index, with no issuers being removed from both categories.

tickerNews.title: US President Donald Trump Postpones 50% Tariff on EU Imports to July 9, 2025
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, said on Sunday (25/5) that the US will delay the implementation of a 50% tariff on the European Union from June 1, 2025, to July 9, 2025, to allow time for negotiations with the bloc. This postponement came just 2 days after Trump on Friday (23/5) threatened to impose a 50% tariff on all imports from the European Union due to a lack of progress in trade negotiations with the bloc.

tickerNews.title: Minister of ESDM Inaugurates RUPTL 2025-2034, Targeting 69.5 GW Additional Power Capacity, Primarily from New and Renewable Energy
tickerNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, on Monday (26/5) inaugurated the Electricity Supply Business Plan (RUPTL) for the period 2025-2034, where the government targets an additional electricity capacity of 69.5 GW. Of this amount, 42.6 GW or 61% comes from new and renewable energy, 10.3 GW or 15% comes from energy storage capacity, and 16.6 GW or 24% from fossil fuels such as gas and coal. Specifically, the addition of renewable energy is targeted to come from PLTS (Solar Power Plant) by 17.1 GW, PLTA (Hydro Power Plant) by 11.7 GW, PLTB (Wind Power Plant) by 7.2 GW, PLTP (Geothermal Power Plant) by 5.2 GW, PLTBio (Bioenergy) by 0.9 GW, and PLTN (Nuclear Power Plant) by 0.5 GW.

tickerNews.title: TAYS Controller Sells Approximately 49.8 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Shareholder of Jaya Swarasa Agung (TAYS), Lidya Anwar, sold approximately 49.8 million TAYS shares at a price of 60 rupiah per share on May 14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Lidya Anwar's ownership in TAYS decreased from 4.53% to none.

tickerNews.title: AIMS Controller Sells Approximately 45.6 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Artha Mahiya Investama (AIMS), PT AIMS Indo Investama, sold approximately 45.6 million AIMS shares at a price of 292 rupiah per share on May 26, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 13.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT AIMS Indo Investama's ownership in AIMS decreased from 61.07% to 40.35%.

tickerNews.title: VKTR Controller (BNBR) Sells Approximately 1.8 Billion Shares of BNBR
tickerNews.content: The controller of VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas (VKTR), Bakrie & Brothers (BNBR), sold approximately 1.8 billion BNBR shares at a price of 75 rupiah per share on May 22, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 134 billion rupiah. After this transaction, BNBR's ownership in VKTR decreased from 28.5% to 24.4%.
